result.execSummary:
The defendant Kasey P Buss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kasey P Buss is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kasey P Buss was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: to Appear s/BNB/1-20-17
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Kasey P Buss in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this is a motion to terminate the DPA and in speaking with Atty Gumz, the defendant is not objecting the termination.  Atty Gumz agrees and asks to proceed with sentencing.
BY THE COURT:  Motion to terminate the DPA is granted.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations on Ct. 1.
Atty Gumz agrees and makes arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Court finds the defendant guilty of Ct. 1.
Pay fine and costs = $418.38
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on March 1, 2017
Motion hearing on January 19, 2017 at 11:45 am.
Motion hearing on January 19, 2017 at 11:45 am.
to Terminate Deferred Prosecution Agreement
in Support to Motion to Terminate Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Deferred Prosecution Agreement s/BNB/10-10-16

Defendant Kasey P Buss in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant plead out and shortly after her hearing; the defendant wrote a letter to withdraw her plea.  Court states that the plea rights were given  to the defendant.  Court received the letter to withdraw the plea.  Court questions the defendant.
Atty Hendee takes no position on the matter.  

BY THE COURT:  Court will grant the defendant's motion to withdraw her plea. Court notes the waiver of counsel made by the defendant previously.

Atty Hendee states that a DPA is on it's way up if the court would like to go through with it today.  Ms. Buss would like to finish it up today.
BY THE COURT:  Court will recall after 11:00am


BACK ON THE RECORD:

BY THE COURT:  Court will vacate the judgment from Sept. 7th.

  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.    Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of:  12 months with conditions.
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.   Defendant waives their right to an attorney and wants to proceed.  Defendant agrees and enters a Guilty plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and approves the 12 month DPA with conditions on Ct. 1.
Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

09-08-16 Letter from Defendant requesting case be reopened
(Judge had it set for Motin to Reopen Hearing)
Motion hearing on October 10, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Payment Plan signed 09-07-16

Defendant Kasey P Buss in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.   Court questions the defendant.  Defendant wants to go with the offer that includes the fine.   Defendant enters a Guilty plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  Pay fine of $75.00 + costs = $418.38
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Criminal Complaint
-served by MASO before Court

Pre-trial conference on August 9, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Return date on September 7, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

with conditions:
*Appear for booking today

Defendant Kasey P Buss in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court confirms the defendant's address.  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today

Court questions the defendant.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.    Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return and pre-trial  Return date scheduled for September 7, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 9, 2016 at 09:45 am.
